statement.title: # Content
statement.content: A regular dice is a cube with $6$ numbers ($1$ to $6$) on its $6$ faces. When you look at a corner of a dice you can see $3$ faces and of course the numbers on them. Now you're given $8$ views from $8$ corners of a dice, and your task is to tell what number is on the opposite side of a given number.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content:
One integer $T$ on the first line indicates the number of cases. 

Then followed by $T$ cases, every case contains $8$ lines. Each line contains $3$ integers $A$, $B$, $C$ describing the view from one corner of the dice (look at the picture for details). 

![.*](/source/lutece/guess-the-dice/img/aHR0cHM6Ly9oZXJhbm8uZ2l0aHViLmlvL2ltYWdlcy9MdXRlY2UvMTIxLnBuZw==.png)

It's not guaranteed that the order of the $8$ views is given in the same way as the sample input.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: For each case, print $6$ integers separated by space on a line. The $i$-th number indicates the number on the opposite side of $i$.

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
1 1 2 3 1 3 4 1 4 5 1 5 2 6 3 2 6 4 3 6 5 4 6 2 56 4 5 2 3 1
